pros: Great coworkers, faculty and student body. PTO and Sick time. Free education.
cons: Though they offer some benefits, there is no time to use them. You are expected to be available at all times, weekends included for the most mundane of tasks. There are no raises or any room for growth unless someone quits. "Other duties as assigned" is a soft way of saying you will do whatever we ask you to do. Management also likes to make up rules about when you can take your vacation which leads to you never using it and losing hours.

cons: Like other smaller schools, "other duties assigned" is stretched to mean numerous random tasks/responsibilities and occasionally makes it difficult to get other work opportunities.

Their expectations are if you are salary there should be no reason why you can't work 10+ hour days (including weekends and holidays) You're volun-told to do multiple things outside of your job description with no compensation of any means.
